content:
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import numpy as np

plt.style.use('seaborn')
fig, ax = plt.subplots(figsize=(10, 6))

x = [100.0, 20.0, 15.0, 150.0]
y = [40.0, 25.0, 80.0, 30.0, 10.0]
sizes = np.random.randint(50, 500, len(x))
colors = np.random.rand(len(x))

ax.scatter(x, y, s=sizes, c=colors, alpha=0.5, cmap='viridis')
ax.set_xlabel('X Values')
ax.set_ylabel('Y Values')
ax.set_title('Product Analysis')
ax.grid(True, alpha=0.3)

plt.colorbar(ax.collections[0], ax=ax, label='Color Scale')
plt.tight_layout()
description: Data extracted from user request for Product Analysis showing a downward trend from 100.00 to 10.00
insights: Point 7 is an outlier with value 150.00
Peak at Point 7 (150.00), lowest at Point 17 (10.00)
